description: This trap signals that a statistics table was cleared. The type of table cleared in indicated
by the statsTableReset varbind. The standard varbinds will indicate the time etc.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableCleared NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity i 2 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableReset i 1

description: A counting sequence number, used to identify the order of traps as well as detect gaps in a received trap sequence.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence

description: Description.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex

description: The severity level of the alert from Recovery to Critical
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity

description: This is a unique number which identifies the type of alert. It is an alternative to using the OID as a unique trap type identifier.
See detailed decription for NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::NetopAlertType.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType

description: This is the system data and time when the alert-causing event occurred.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime

description: This is an optional text message to provide additional details about the alert.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage

description: Writing a value to this object will reset the specified stats counters and generate a statsTableCleared trap.
Which table to clear is specified by the value of the object. Writing a 1 or na value will have no effect
it can be used to confirm the write access to the object without clearing any table.
This object will always read na(1).
variables.name: NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableReset

description: This trap signals that a statistics table was cleared. The type of table cleared in indicated
by the statsTableReset varbind. The standard varbinds will indicate the time etc.
The OID of this trap does not conform to RFC2576 v1/v2c
interoperability requirements and is deprecated. It should
be replaced with statsTableCleared trap.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableClearedPreV41 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity i 2 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableReset i 1

description: A counting sequence number, used to identify the order of traps as well as detect gaps in a received trap sequence.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence

description: Description.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex

description: The severity level of the alert from Recovery to Critical
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity

description: This is a unique number which identifies the type of alert. It is an alternative to using the OID as a unique trap type identifier.
See detailed decription for NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::NetopAlertType.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType

description: This is the system data and time when the alert-causing event occurred.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime

description: This is an optional text message to provide additional details about the alert.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage

description: Writing a value to this object will reset the specified stats counters and generate a statsTableCleared trap.
Which table to clear is specified by the value of the object. Writing a 1 or na value will have no effect
it can be used to confirm the write access to the object without clearing any table.
This object will always read na(1).
variables.name: NETOPTICS-STATS-MIB::statsTableReset
